title: Application
description: Details related to the application generated interactions. Application refers to a software experience, such as a mobile or desktop application that can be installed, run, closed, or uninstalled by an end user. Details are not intended to describe agents such as chatbots, browser-based plugins, or other experiences that do not apply to applications.

xdm:crashes.description: Triggered when the application does not exit gracefully. Event is sent on application launch after a crash.

xdm:featureUsages.description: Activation of an application feature that is being measured.

xdm:installs.description: Install of an application on a device where the specific install event is available.

xdm:firstLaunches.description: Triggered on first launch after install.

xdm:launches.description: Launch of an application. Triggered on every run, including crashes and installs. Also triggered on a resume from background when the session timeout has been exceeded.

xdm:launchCount.title: Launch Count
xdm:launchCount.description: Total number of launch events for this application.

xdm:upgrades.description: Upgrade of an application that has previously been installed. Triggered on first launch after upgrade.

xdm:userPerspective.description: The perspective/physical relationship between the user and the app/brand at the time the event happened.  The most common are the app being in the foreground with the user directly interacting with it vs the app being in the background and still generating events.  Detached means the event was related to the app but didn't come directly from the app like the sending of an email or push notification from an external system.  Understanding the perspective of the user in relation to the app helps with accuratly generating sessions as the majority of the time you will not want to include background and detached events as part of an active session.

xdm:launchType.description: Specifies the launch event type. Install indicates this is the first application launch after the application was installed. Upgrade indicates this is the first application launch after the application was upgraded. Launch is an application launch which is not after an application install or upgrade.

xdm:closeType.description: Specifies the close event type. A value of close means the application signaled that it has closed, either by a user action or by the device. Unknown means the application did not signal that it closed, which could indicate an application crash, a system failure, or an improperly configured application.

xdm:sessionLength.title: Session length
xdm:sessionLength.description: Reports the number of seconds that a previous application session lasted based on how long the application was open and in the foreground. Included with close event.

xdm:ignoredSessionLength.title: Ignored session length
xdm:ignoredSessionLength.description: If the previous session lasts longer than the maxSessionLength, that session length is ignored and recorded here. Included with close event.

xdm:daysSinceFirstUse.title: Days since first use
xdm:daysSinceFirstUse.description: Number of days since first launch event.

xdm:daysSinceLastUse.title: Days since last use
xdm:daysSinceLastUse.description: Number of days since last launch event.

xdm:daysSinceLastUpgrade.title: Days since last upgrade
xdm:daysSinceLastUpgrade.description: Number of days since last upgrade event.

xdm:launchesSinceLastUpgrade.title: Launches since last upgrade
xdm:launchesSinceLastUpgrade.description: Number of launch events since last upgrade event.

xdm:installDate.title: Install date
xdm:installDate.description: Date of first launch after installation.

xdm:dayOfWeek.title: Day of week
xdm:dayOfWeek.description: Measures the day of the week the app was launched.

xdm:hourOfDay.title: Hour of day
xdm:hourOfDay.description: Measures the hour the app was launched and uses the 24-hour numerical format. Used for time parting to determine peak usage times.
